lx4p

Class LXUPnPDiscoverer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lx4p.LXUPnPDiscoverer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LXUPnPDiscoverer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    LXUPnPDiscoverer is a class for implementing Universal Plug and Play discovery. It implements runnable so it can search for a device in its own thread. LXUPnPDiscoverer sends an M-SEARCH to the SSDP multicast address. It then listens for reply packets. When it receives an SSDP packet containing the targetServer, it retrieves the XML device description from the location in the SSDP packet. It calls its delegate's foundURLBase method with the device URLBase string.
    Version:
    001
    Author:
    Claude Heintz
    See Also:
    LXUPnPDelegate

      • run

        public void run()

      • readPacket

        public int readPacket()
        Attempt to read an SSDP packet from udpsocket When an SSDP packet is received, looks for the targetServer string in the server line. If the packet is of interest, use the location to read the device description XML. Calls getDescription to read the URLBase property from the XML returned from location
        Returns:
        0 for no packet, 1 for packet but did not retrieve urlBase, 2 if got urlBase

      • sendSearch

        public void sendSearch()
        Sends a search request to the SSDP multicast address. The search target is any basic device on the network

      • getDescription

        public void getDescription(java.net.URL location)
        Reads an XML Description and extracts the URLBase
        Parameters:
        location - is the URL of the description XML resource

      • close

        public void close()
        stops the search and closes the udpsocket if it exists

      • createUPnPDiscoverer

        public static LXUPnPDiscoverer createUPnPDiscoverer(java.lang.String networkInterface,
                                    java.lang.String networkAddress,
                                    java.lang.String target)
        Factory method to create an LXUPnPDiscoverer
        Parameters:
        networkInterface - if not null, searches for an InetAddress associated with the named interface (eg "en0")
        networkAddress - specific IP address to use for binding socket. Can be null if networkInterface is specified
        Returns:
        created instance of LXUPnPDiscovereror null if socket could not be opened
